channel.title: What could be use for this idea
channel.description:
im planing on making a mmo my limit is up to 3 years in dev if i dont get it runing in 3 years im droping it but the concept is
BulletStorm Online
its based on the console game bullet storm and its going to be mmo obv the graphics aint gunna be stunning off the bat as im new to it but what programs could i use to make this
What will be needed
and whats a good softwaree

item.title: What could be use for this idea
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

A 3 year limit? If you’re making a full game by yourself, it will take longer than this.

Read full topic
item.source: What could be use for this idea

item.title: What could be use for this idea
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

Pick the language you want to write it in first. After that start reading up on models, graphics libraries, and more. Developing a game takes a lot of time and patience, especially while doing it by yourself. I’d suggest start by learning the concepts of networking since that will be needed if you want to have anything multi-player. After that it is whatever way you wish to lean, you can start by writing the system for loading and interacting with models, or play with graphics. Regardless it is a lot of work. I’ve experimented with 3D game design but I stopped shortly after I realized how much work it was. 2D games are a lot simpler when first getting started. Might want to start with that, then progress once you have the knowledge. Good luck.

Read full topic
item.source: What could be use for this idea

item.title: What could be use for this idea
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote="s, post:10, topic:427773"][quote author=lemme_winks link=topic=530467.msg3874121#msg3874121 date=1325543482]
http://gamedev.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=529040.msg3862661

already written for you, man. if you don’t like the idea of writing your own games, doing everything yourself, essentially being a bad-ass, then maybe this isn’t for you. there are a ton of pre-made engines out there that implement a drag-and-drop style and allow you to just script whatever you add into your game. a few good examples might be:

unreal engine
and unity
[/quote]unreal for mmos? you nuts?[/quote]

well if anyone is going to make an mmo it’s going to be written

damn straight

Read full topic
